pattern.name: Little Stegosaur
pattern.gauge_description: 22 stitches and 30 rows = 4 inches in stockinette stitch with larger needles
pattern.notes_html:
JANE BURNS has given her button-up
hooded cardigan a dinosaur theme, by
adding knitted spikes down the centre
back, and an adorable little tail! These
are knitted separately and sewn on to
the finished garment. The project is
sized to fit babies and toddlers aged
from birth to five years, and would
make a fun gift for any little one. It’s
knitted in King Cole, Big Value (50g) DK a machine-washable acrylic yarn.

YARN
King Cole, Big Value (50g) DK (DK weight; 100% premium acrylic; 145m per 50g)

PLATINUM (4051)

4 4 5 5 6 6 x50G BALLS

Plus 1 x 50g ball of each: B Bordeaux (4032); C Leaf (4059); D Mustard (4026) for spikes

SIZE
AGE

0-6 9-12 12-18 18-24 2-3 4-5

TO FIT
CHEST

43 45.5 48 53 56 61 cm
17 18 18.75 20.75 22 24 in

ACTUAL
CHEST

48 52 59 62 65.5 69 cm
19 20.5 23.25 24.5 25.25 27.75 in

ACTUAL
LENGTH

27 29 32 34 34 37 cm
10.5 11.5 12.5 13.5 13.5 14.5 in

packs.yarn_name: King Cole Big Value Double Knitting

pattern_author.name: Jane Burns
pattern_author.notes:
Hello. I’m Jane.

I create beautiful designs for knitters and crocheters who love to work with gorgeous yarns. I help them to make fun and playful projects that are an indulgence to work on and a treat to wear.

My designs are perfect for those who love to create intricate looking projects without lots of complicated instructions. I believe that crafting should be a relaxing pleasure. It’s my mission to bring clear and easy to execute designs, which are accessible for newer knitters and provide instant gratification for the more experienced.

I’ve designed patterns for a variety of publications, including The Knitter, Let’s Knit, Knit Now, Knit Today, Art of Knitting and Love Knitting for Baby. I’ve also produced a mini collection for Eden Cottage Yarns as well as co-authoring Crochet Infinity Scarves: 8 Simple Infinity Scarves to Crochet. My slightly quirkier work has been featured on television alongside Harry Hill.

When I’m not designing my latest socks or playing with beautiful hand dyed yarns from the dyers I love, you’ll find me knitting quietly in the corner of a comedy club, or at a live gig (I usually leave the knitting at home in this case!) As a result, you’ll find my work is influenced a lot by music, my other main passion.

I share my life with my husband, Doug,  my three children and my mini schnauzer Bertie.

If you’re ready to join in the fun, you can check out my tutorials or join my newsletter to [download your free gift  here][1].

***You can buy my patterns from my [Ravelry store, here][2]***

If you would like to discuss commission a design, I would love to hear from you drop me a line.

If you would like to become part of the [Jane Burns Designs community][3], please join the group and say hello….


  [1]: http://eepurl.com/bDxbrH
  [2]: http://www.ravelry.com/stores/knitting-image--designs-by-jane-burns
  [3]: http://www.ravelry.com/groups/jane-burns-designs

If you would like to become part of the Jane Burns Designs community, please join the group and say hello….

users.about_me:
Hello. I’m Jane.

I create beautiful designs for knitters and crocheters who love to work with gorgeous yarns. I help them to make fun and playful projects that are an indulgence to work on and a treat to wear.

My designs are perfect for those who love to create intricate looking projects without lots of complicated instructions. I believe that crafting should be a relaxing pleasure. It’s my mission to bring clear and easy to execute designs, which are accessible for newer knitters and provide instant gratification for the more experienced.

I’ve designed patterns for a variety of publications, including The Knitter, Let’s Knit, Knit Now, Knit Today, Art of Knitting and Love Knitting for Baby. Had the privilege of designing for Eden Cottage Yarns, King Cole and a Scheepjes.   My slightly quirkier work has been featured on television alongside Harry Hill.

When I’m not designing my latest socks or playing with beautiful hand dyed yarns from the dyers I love, you’ll find me knitting quietly in the corner of a comedy club, or at a live gig (I usually leave the knitting at home in this case!) As a result, you’ll find my work is influenced a lot by music, my other main passion.

I share my life with my husband, Doug, who proposed at a Foo Fighters gig (the song was Everlong, if you’re a fellow Foos fan) and my three children and Bertie my mini schnauzer.

If you’re ready to join in the fun, you can check out my tutorials or join my newsletter to download your free sock pattern [here][1].


***You can buy my patterns from my Ravelry store***, [here][2]

If you would like to discuss commission a design, I would love to hear from you drop me a line.

If you would like to become part of the [Jane Burns Designs community,][3] please join the group and say hello....


  [1]: http://eepurl.com/bDxbrH
  [2]: http://www.ravelry.com/stores/knitting-image--designs-by-jane-burns
  [3]: http://www.ravelry.com/groups/jane-burns-designs

Hello. I’m Jane.

I create beautiful designs for knitters and crocheters who love to work with gorgeous yarns. I help them to make fun and playful projects that are an indulgence to work on and a treat to wear.

My designs are perfect for those who love to create intricate looking projects without lots of complicated instructions. I believe that crafting should be a relaxing pleasure. It’s my mission to bring clear and easy to execute designs, which are accessible for newer knitters and provide instant gratification for the more experienced.

I’ve designed patterns for a variety of publications, including The Knitter, Let’s Knit, Knit Now, Knit Today, Art of Knitting and Love Knitting for Baby. When I’m not designing my latest socks or playing with beautiful hand dyed yarns from the dyers I love, you’ll find me knitting quietly in the corner of a comedy club, or at a live gig (I usually leave the knitting at home in this case!)
